Name: OpenAPI V3 - Info Contact
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that OpenAPI info object has a contact. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that all APIs have contact information.","message":"API must have a contact information available.","given":"$.info","severity":"error","recommended":true,"type":"style","formats":["oas3"],"then":{"field":"contact","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: API must have contact information available
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's info object doesn't contain a contact object, which contains contact information including a name and email address.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although contact information isn't required, including it allows your users to contact you. Add a contact object to your API schema's info object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Info Contact Email
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that OpenAPI info object has a contact email. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that all APIs have contact email.","message":"API must have a contact email available.","given":"$.info.contact","severity":"error","then":{"field":"email","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: API must have a contact email available
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's contact object doesn't contain an email address for the contact person or organization.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although contact information isn't required, including it allows your users to communicate with you. Add an email address to your API schema's contact object.

Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that OpenAPI info object has a contact name. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.

LC Rule Name / Rule Message: API must have a contact name available
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's contact object doesn't contain a name for the contact person or organization.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although contact information isn't required, including it allows your users to communicate with you. Add a name to your API schema's contact object.

LC Issue Description: Your API schema's contact object doesn't contain a URL for the contact person or organization.

Name: OpenAPI V3 Info Description
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that an OpenAPI has a description included as part of the information object, making sure there is as much detail about what an API does available for consumers. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that all OpenAPIs have a information description.","message":"The info object should have a description.","given":"$.info","severity":"error","recommended":true,"type":"style","formats":["oas3"],"then":{"field":"description","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: The info object should have a description
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's info object doesn't contain a description.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although a description isn't required, including it allows you to provide your users with information about what the API does. Add a description to your API schema's info object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Info License
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that OpenAPI info object has a license. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that all OpenAPIs have a information object license.","message":"The info object should have a license.","given":"$.info","severity":"error","recommended":true,"type":"style","formats":["oas3"],"then":{"field":"license","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: The info object should have a license
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's info object doesn't contain a license object, which specifies information about the schema's license.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although a license object isn't required, including one provides your users with important information. Add a license object to your API schema's info object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Info License Url
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that OpenAPI info object has a license url. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that all OpenAPIs have a information object license url.","message":"The info object should have a license url.","given":"$.info.license","severity":"error","then":{"field":"url","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: The info object should have a license URL
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's license object doesn't contain a URL to the license used for the API.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although license information isn't required, including it provides your users with important information. Add a URL to your API schema's license object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Info Terms Of Service
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that OpenAPI info object has a terms of service. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that all OpenAPIs have a information object terms of service.","message":"The info object should have a terms of service.","given":"$.info","severity":"error","recommended":true,"type":"style","formats":["oas3"],"then":{"field":"termsOfService","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: The info object should have terms of service
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's info object doesn't contain a URL to the Terms of Service for the API.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although a link to the Terms of Service isn't required, including it provides your users with important information. Add a URL to the API's Terms of Service to your API schema's info object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Info X API Id
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that the OpenAPI info has an API ID extension. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that all OpenAPIs have a information object API ID extension.","message":"The info object should have an API ID extension.","given":"$.info","severity":"error","recommended":true,"type":"style","then":{"field":"x-api-id","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: The info object should have an API ID extension
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's info object doesn't contain an API ID extension (x-api-id), which is a custom header used to pass an API key.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although an API ID extension isn't required, including it provides your users with important information. Add an API ID extension to your API schema's info object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Info X Audience
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that the OpenAPI info has an audience extension. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that all OpenAPIs have a information object audience extension.","message":"The info object should have an audience extension.","severity":"error","given":"$.info","then":{"field":"x-audience","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: The info object should have an audience extension
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's info object doesn't contain an audience extension (x-audience), which is a custom header used to describe an API's target audience.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although an audience extension isn't required, including it provides your users with important information about the API. Add an audience extension to your API schema's info object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - No Empty Paths
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that there are no empty paths in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that there are no empty paths.","message":"There should be no empty paths.","documentationUrl":"https://opensource.zalando.com/restful-api-guidelines/#136","severity":"error","given":"$.paths.*~","then":{"function":"pattern","functionOptions":{"notMatch":"//"}}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: There should be no empty paths
LC Issue Description: Your API schema contains one or more empty path item objects in the paths object. <!-- TODO: confirm that this is correct - might be the paths object instead? -->
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Although you can leave a path item object empty due to access-control list (ACL) constraints, this doesn't provide your users with a good experience. Add details for any empty path item objects in your API schema.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - No Trailing Slash on Paths
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that there are no trailing slashes on paths in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that there are no trailing slashes on paths.","message":"There should be no trailing slashes on paths.","severity":"error","given":"$.paths.*~","then":{"function":"pattern","functionOptions":{"notMatch":"/$"}}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: There should be no trailing slashes on paths
LC Issue Description: One or more path item objects in your API schema's paths object have a trailing slash at the end of the path.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Some tools treat a path that ends with a trailing slash (/path/) differently from way that they treat paths without a trailing slash (/path). To avoid any ambiguity, remove any trailing slashes from paths in your API schema's paths object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Tags Object
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that there is a central tag object within OpenAPI definitions. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensuring that there are tags being applied.","message":"You should have a central tags object.","given":"$","severity":"error","then":{"field":"tags","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: There should be a central tags object
LC Issue Description: Your API schema doesn't contain a root-level tags object.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): The tags object lists all the tags used in the schema's operation objects, providing users with important context. Add a tags object to your API schema.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Tags Description
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all tags have a description within OpenAPI definitions. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensuring that all tags have a description.","message":"All tags should have a description.","given":"$.tags[*]","severity":"error","then":{"field":"description","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All tags should have a description
LC Issue Description: One or more tags in your API schema's tags object don't have an accompanying description.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Tag descriptions enable you to provide your users with important context. Add a description for every tag in the tags object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Tags One
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that there is at least one tag within OpenAPI definitions. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensuring that there is at least on tag being applied.","message":"You should have at least one tag.","given":"$","severity":"error","then":{"field":"tags","function":"length","functionOptions":{"min":1}},"type":"style"}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: There should be at least one tag
LC Issue Description: Your API schema's tags object doesn't contain any tags.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Tags enable you to provide your users with important context. Add at least one tag to your schema's tags object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Operations Description
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that some words are never used in the description of operations within an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that each of the operations have a description.","message":"Your operations all need descriptions.","severity":"error","given":"$.paths.*[get,post,patch,put,delete]","then":[{"field":"description","function":"truthy"}]}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Your operations all need descriptions
LC Issue Description: One or more operation objects in your API schema doesn't have a description.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): A verbose explanation of the operation's behavior provides your users with important context. Add a description for each operation object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Operations Summary
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all operations have summaries. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that each of the operations for an API have a summary.","message":"All of your operations need summaries.","severity":"error","given":"$.paths.*[get,post,patch,put,delete]","then":[{"field":"summary","function":"truthy"}]}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All of your operations need summaries
LC Issue Description: One or more operation objects in your API schema doesn't have a summary.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): A short summary of what the operation does provides your users with important context. Add a summary for each operation object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Operations Summary Period None
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that operation summaries do not have a ending period. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"severity":"error","description":"Ensures that each of the operations summaries do not have an ending period.","message":"Your operations summaries should not end with a period.","given":"$.paths[*][*].summary","then":{"function":"pattern","functionOptions":{"notMatch":"\\.$"}}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Your operations summaries should not end with a period
LC Issue Description: One or more operation objects in your API schema contains a summary that ends with a period (.).
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Remove the final period from all summaries at the operations object level in your API schema.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Operations Tags
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all operations have a tags property. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that each of the operations have a tags property.","message":"All of your operations need to have tags.","severity":"error","given":"$.paths.*[get,post,patch,put,delete]","then":[{"field":"tags","function":"truthy"}]}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All of your operations need to have tags
LC Issue Description: One or more operation objects in your API schema does not contain a tags array.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Operation tags can be used to create logical groupings of operations in API documentation. Add a tags array for each operation object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Operations Tags One
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all operations have at least one tag. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that each of the operations have at least one tag.","message":"All of your operations need to have at least one tag.","given":"$","severity":"error","then":{"field":"tags","function":"length","functionOptions":{"min":1}},"type":"style"}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All of your operations need to have at least one tag
LC Issue Description: One or more operation objects in your API schema contains a tags array, but the array does not contain any items.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Operation tags can be used to create logical groupings of operations in API documentation. Add at least one tag to the tags array for each operation object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Parameters Description
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all parameters have a description in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that that all parameters have a descriptions.","message":"Your parameters all need descriptions.","given":"$.paths.*.*.parameters[?(@.in=='query')]","then":{"field":"description","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Your parameters all need descriptions
LC Issue Description: One or more parameter objects in an operations object in your API schema doesn't contain a description field.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): A brief description of the parameter provides your users with important context. Add a description field for each parameter object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Parameters Example
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all parameters have an example in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that that all parameters have a examples.","message":"Your parameters all need examples.","given":"$.paths.*.*.parameters[?(@.example=='query')]","then":[{"field":"example","function":"truthy"},{"field":"examples","function":"truthy"}]}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Your parameters all need examples
LC Issue Description: One or more parameter objects in an operations object in your API schema doesn't contain an example field.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Add an example field to provide your users with an example of the parameter's potential value.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Request Body on POST
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that POST methods have a request body in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that POST methods have request bodies.","message":"Your POST methods should have request bodies.","given":"$.paths.*.post","recommended":true,"severity":"error","then":{"field":"requestBody","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Your POST methods should have request bodies
LC Issue Description: One or more POST operation objects in your API schema doesn't contain a request body object.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): A request body object contains a brief description of the response body and information about what a valid response body should look like. Add a request body object to any POST operation operation objects.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Request Body on PUT
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that PUT methods have a request body in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that PUT methods have request bodies.","message":"Your PUT methods should have request bodies.","given":"$.paths.*.put","recommended":true,"severity":"error","then":{"field":"requestBody","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Your PUT methods should have request bodies
LC Issue Description: One or more PUT operation objects in your API schema doesn't contain a request body object.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): A request body object contains a brief description of the response body and information about what a valid response body should look like. Add a request body object to any POST operation operation objects.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Request Body on PATCH
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that PATCH methods have a request body in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures that PATCH methods have request bodies.","message":"Your PATCH methods should have request bodies.","given":"$.paths.*.patch","recommended":true,"severity":"error","then":{"field":"requestBody","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Your PATCH methods should have request bodies
LC Issue Description: One or more PATCH operation objects in your API schema doesn't contain a request body object.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): A request body object contains a brief description of the response body and information about what a valid response body should look like. Add a request body object to any POST operation operation objects.

Name: OpenAPI V3 Have Request Body Examples
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that all OpenAPI request bodies have an example present, showing what is expected when a request body is submitted as part of an API request. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"severity":"error","description":"Ensures that a example is always present for each request body.","message":"All request bodies should have an example present.","given":"$.paths.*.*.requestBody..[?(@.items)][?(@.type == 'object')]","formats":["oas3"],"then":[{"field":"example","function":"truthy"}]}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All request bodies should have an example present
LC Issue Description: One or more request body objects in your API schema doesn't contain at least one example.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): An example shows your users what is expected when a request body is submitted as part of an API request. Add one or more examples to any body request objects.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Responses Examples
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all responses have examples in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensuring all responses have examples defined.","message":"All your responses need to have examples defined.","severity":"error","given":"$..responses..[?(@property !== 'properties' && @.examples)]","then":{"function":"schemaPath","functionOptions":{"field":"$.examples.*.value","schemaPath":"$.schema"}}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All your responses need to have examples defined
LC Issue Description: One or more response objects in your API schema doesn't contain an example.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): An example shows your users the kind of response they can expect from the API. Add an example to any response objects.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Response DELETE 204 No Body
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that DELETE methods do not have a response body in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures DELETE operations do not have a response body.","message":"A DELETE operation should not have a response body.","severity":"error","given":"$paths.delete.responses.204","then":{"field":"content","function":"falsy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: A DELETE operation should not have a response body
LC Issue Description: One or more DELETE operation objects in your API schema contains a response body.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Make sure that DELETE methods do not have a response body.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Response DELETE 204 Status Code
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that DELETE methods all have a 204 status code response in an OpenAPI. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures DELETE operations have a 204 status code response.","message":"A DELETE operation should have a 204 status code for the response.","severity":"warn","formats":["oas2","oas3"],"given":"$.paths[*].delete.responses","then":{"field":"204","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: A DELETE operation should have a 204 status code for the response
LC Issue Description: The responses object for one or more DELETE operation objects in your API schema doesn't contain the 204 status code.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Make sure that DELETE methods all have a 204 status code response.

LC Rule Name / Rule Message: A DELETE operation should have a 500 status code for the response

Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensures PUT operations have a 500 status code response.","message":"A PUT operation should have a 500 status code for the response.","severity":"warn","formats":["oas2","oas3"],"given":"$.paths[*].put.responses","then":{"field":"500","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: A PUT operation should have a 500 status code for the response
LC Issue Description: The responses object for one or more PUT operation objects in your API schema doesn't contain the 500 status code.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Make sure that PUT methods all have a 500 status code response.

Name: OpenAPI V3 Request Body Examples Components
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that the OpenAPI request body examples are all centralized as a component. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Check request bodies examples to ensure that they only have references to components.","message":"Request bodies examples should only reference components.","severity":"error","resolved":false,"given":["$..requestBody.content..*.examples.$ref"],"then":{"function":"pattern","functionOptions":{"match":"#/components/"}}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Request bodies examples should only reference components
LC Issue Description: Multiple request body objects in your API schema contain examples that should be consolidated into an examples section <!-- TODO: or should this be the requestBodies section? --> in the components object.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Consolidate all the examples from your request bodies into an examples section in the components object.

Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that the OpenAPI request body schema are all centralized as a component. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Check request body schena to ensure that they only have references to components.","message":"Request body schema should only reference components.","severity":"error","resolved":false,"given":["$..requestBody.content..*.schema.$ref"],"then":{"function":"pattern","functionOptions":{"match":"#/components/"}}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Request body schema should only reference components
LC Issue Description: Multiple request body objects in your API schema contain schemas that should be consolidated into a schemas section in the components object.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Consolidate all the schemas from your request bodies into a schemas section in the components object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 Responses Schema Components

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Description
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all schema in an OpenAPI have a description.. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensure all schema properties should have a description.","message":"All schema should have descriptions.","severity":"warn","formats":["oas3"],"given":"$.components.schemas.*","then":{"field":"description","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All schema should have descriptions
LC Issue Description: One or more schema objects in your API schema's components object doesn't contain a description.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Add a description for every schema object in your API schema.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Properties
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all schema have properties within OpenAPI definitions. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensuring that all schema should have properties.","message":"All of your schema need to have properties.","severity":"error","formats":["oas3"],"given":"$.components.schemas.*","then":{"field":"properties","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All of your schemas need to have properties
LC Issue Description: One or more schema objects in your API schema's components object doesn't contain at least one property.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Add a property for every schema object in your API schema.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Properties Allowed Integer Format
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that OpenAPI properties that use integer type have a format of int32 or int64. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Requires integer properties to have a format of int32 or int64.","message":"Type format should be be int32 or int64.","formats":["oas3"],"severity":"hint","recommended":true,"given":"$..properties.[?(@.type==\"integer\")]","then":{"field":"format","function":"enumeration","functionOptions":{"values":["int32","int64"]}}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Type format should be int32 or int64
LC Issue Description: One or more schema objects in your API schema's components object has an integer type property but doesn't specify int32 or int64 format.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Make sure that properties that have integer type in your API schema have a format of int32 or int64.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Properties Allowed Number Format
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that OpenAPI properties that use number type have a format of decimal32, decimal64, float, double, or decimal128. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensure only allowed number formats.","message":"You must have format property of decimal32, decimal64, float, double, decimal128","formats":["oas3"],"severity":"hint","recommended":true,"given":"$..properties.[?(@.type==\"number\")]","then":{"field":"format","function":"enumeration","functionOptions":{"values":["decimal32","decimal64","float","double","decimal128"]}}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: You must have format property of decimal32, decimal64, float, double, decimal128
LC Issue Description: One or more schema objects in your API schema's components object has a number type property but doesn't specify decimal32, decimal64, float, double, or decimal128 format.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Make sure that properties that have number type in your API schema have a format of decimal32, decimal64, float, double, or decimal128.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Properties Define Array Boundaries
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to enforce that arrays in an OpenAPI always have minimum and maximum boundaries define, preventing these properties from being overloaded. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Requires that arrays have their minimum and maximum boundaries defined.","message":"Arrays must have minItems and maxItems defined.","formats":["oas3"],"severity":"warn","recommended":true,"given":["$..properties.[?(@.type==\"array\")]"],"then":[{"field":"maxItems","function":"defined"},{"field":"minItems","function":"defined"}]}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: Arrays must have minItems and maxItems defined
LC Issue Description: One or more schema objects in your API schema's components object has an array type property but doesn't define minItem or maxItem.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Defining the minimum and maximum boundaries for arrays in your API schema prevents this type of property from being overloaded. Make sure that properties that have array type in your API schema  have minItem and maxItem defined.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Properties Descriptions
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all schema properties have descriptions within OpenAPI definitions. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensure that all schemas properties should have a description.","message":"All schema properties should have descriptions.","severity":"warn","formats":["oas3"],"given":"$..properties.*","then":{"field":"description","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All schema properties should have descriptions
LC Issue Description: One or more properties in a schema object in your API schema's components object doesn't contain a description.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): A brief description of properties in the API schema provides your users with important context. Add a description for every property in your schema objects.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Properties Type
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that schema properties have a type defined within OpenAPI definitions. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.
Rule JSON: {"description":"Ensuring that all schemas properties should have a type.","message":"All schema properties should have type property.","severity":"warn","formats":["oas3"],"given":"$..properties.*","then":{"field":"type","function":"truthy"}}
LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All schema properties should have a type property
LC Issue Description: One or more properties in a schema object in your API schema's components object doesn't have a type defined.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Add a type for every property in your schema objects.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Required

LC Rule Name / Rule Message: All of your schemas need to have a required property
LC Issue Description: One or more schema objects in your API schema's components object doesn't have a required property defined.
LC Possible Fix (Suggested Fix): Add a required property to every schema object.

Name: OpenAPI V3 - Schema Type
Summary: This is a Spectral governance rule to make sure that all schema have a required property within OpenAPI definitions. Here is a JSON version of the rule that can be applied using this API-driven collection API, or at CLI or CI/CD pipeline.

LC Issue Description: One or more schema objects in your API schema's components object doesn't have a type property defined.
